definition[0]: used to offer to do something
example[0]: I’ll come with you if you want.
definition[1]: used to invite someone to do something or to give them permission
example[2]: You can stay if you want to.
definition[2]: used when someone suggests doing something, to say that you will do it, although you do not especially want to
example[3]: ‘Hey, shall we go to the beach?’ ‘If you want.’
